Cote d'Ivoire - Quatrieme Projet de
            Developpement Heveicole

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fourth Rubber Project
            for the Ivory Coast was satisfactory. The project achieved
            most of its objectives, its impact on institutional
            development has been substantial, sustainability is likely,
            and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, at the planning and appraisal stage of
            project preparation, greater attention should have been
            given to emerging land constraints and agricultural
            encroachment. Second, the financial and economic viability
            of smallholder plantations depends heavily on the quality of
            plantation establishment and maintenance/tapping. Third, the
            profitability of rubber plantations, industrial and
            smallholder, also critically depends on the efficiency of
            downstream processing and marketing operations. Finally,
            with the withdrawal of Government from directly productive
            activities in the rubber sector, future development will be
            entirely based on private sector initiative and private
            operators' satisfactory access to long-term credit for
            financing the necessary investments.
